result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Stephen Alan Meeks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court for Stephen Alan Meeks.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by defense counsel that defendant is in custody in Waukesha County. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephen Alan Meeks not in court.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino appeared by video for Stephen Alan Meeks.  Prosecuting attorney Dax Odom appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR.
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 15.
Calendar call scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Vim Vigor Lofts Apartment Building or within 100 feet of the building, Maisey M., Lyndsey H., Ryan A., Pabst Blue Ribbing Lofts Apartment Building or within 100 of the building, Chauntel M., Sabrina N., Dayshia A.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Stephen Alan Meeks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Stephen Alan Meeks.  Prosecuting attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
